text: Alcohol, sometimes called its chemical name ethanol, is the ingredient in alcoholic drinks such as beer, wine, and distilled spirits (hard liquor). Alcohol is a central nervous system (CNS) depressant. This means that alcohol lowers electrical activity of neurons in the brain.This causes drunkenness. Alcohol can also cause euphoria, decreased anxiety, sociability, sedation, and lowered cognitive, memory, motor, and sensory function. ==Related pages== * Rum-running * Pigovian taxes * Sin taxes * Binge drinking * Drug-related crime ==References== ==Further reading== * ==Other websites== * * The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism maintains a database of alcohol- related health effects. title: Alcohol (drug)
